page.title: 15CHURCH AND RELIGION IN PLATT
page.content: St. Mary the Vigin Platt Church was built in 1853 in an Early English style.It has a square tower with a round turret and it faces east. It is built of Kentish Ragstone with clay tiles on the roof. It is the only place of worship in Platt. It's present vicar is the Rev. Robert Douglas. The seating arrangement are chairs in rows. There are 9 stained glass windows and the organ was put in in 1984. Every Sunday there is a congregation of about 100. In our survey we found that most people who did go to church were Church of England. The are group 5-10 years had the most members of the Church of Enland. There are a few other religions in Platt: Muslims, Roman Catholics and Methodists. Only 35% of people from Platt go to church regularly. 5% go only on special occasions and 60% never go at all.
